sentences.english: When she and her baby went home, was she celebrated or shunned?
sentences.chinese: 当她和她的孩子回家时，她受到欢迎还是受到冷遇？

sentences.english: The minister incurred the king's disfavour.
sentences.chinese: 这位大臣招致国王的冷遇。

sentences.english: His rude behaviour subjects him to frequent rebuffs.
sentences.chinese: 他的粗鲁行为使他经常遭受冷遇。

sentences.english: He is being hit by a serious of embarrassing rebuffs.
sentences.chinese: 他正遭受一系列令他难堪的冷遇。

sentences.english: Former U.S. President Jimmy Carter is getting a cold reception in Israel.
sentences.chinese: 美国前总统卡特在以色列遭到冷遇。

sentences.english: Those who seek asylum also receive short shrift.
sentences.chinese: 寻求庇护者也受到了冷遇。

sentences.english: And the snub undoubtedly creates a precedent other countries may follow.
sentences.chinese: 而这一冷遇无疑为其他国家的跟风开创了先例。

sentences.english: Guo has also occasionally suffered a backlash from the Chinese news media for being standoffish toward reporters.
sentences.chinese: 郭也曾因对记者不友好而遭媒体的冷遇。

sentences.english: When being treated with this type of coldness, what should the passionate public think about the whole thing?
sentences.chinese: 公众参与要是遇到这样的冷遇，该做何想？

sentences.english: Constable's landscapes met with indifference when they were first exhibited.
sentences.chinese: 康斯特布尔的风景画在首次展出时受到了冷遇。

sentences.english: Why is Huntsman so cool on China?
sentences.chinese: 为什么洪博培会如此冷遇中国？

definition: desolate/unfrequented/to treat sb coldly/to snub/to cold shoulder
to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to put up innumerable obstacles/to create all kinds of difficulties (idiom)
to be hard on sb/to deliberately make things difficult
to suffer enough from/to suffer all kinds of/to have one's fill of
to be refused entrance (idiom)/to find the door closed
